nodes.bodyText:
The name of the .description file should be the name of the directory with -s replaced by _s.
jdbc2_complex_type_queries.description
Since we have only one bal file in these examples, shall we update the bal and out file names similarly too?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,6 @@
+// This example demonstrates how to use the JDBC client with complex data types such as arrays,

nodes.bodyText:
I think the names are correct here. Directory name : jdbc2-complex-type-queries, and files names are: jdbc2_complex_type_queries.bal, jdbc2_complex_type_queries.description, jdbc2_complex_type_queries.out. The files names are replaced '-' by '_'.
Is there anything wrong in the above names? Sorry, it's not clear for me what change you wanted to have.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,6 @@
+// This example demonstrates how to use the JDBC client with complex data types such as arrays,

nodes.bodyText: Yeah, sorry my bad, I seem to have misread something. This is correct.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,6 @@
+// This example demonstrates how to use the JDBC client with complex data types such as arrays,

@@ -0,0 +1,6 @@
+// This example demonstrates how to use the JDBC client with complex data types such as arrays,
+// binary, blobs, clob, and date/time fields.
+// Note that the relevant database driver JAR
+//should be placed in the `BALLERINA_HOME/bre/lib` folder. However, this sample is based on an
+//H2 database and the H2 database driver JAR is included by default in the Ballerina distribution.
+//Therefore, it is not required to copy the driver JAR for the H2 database.

nodes.bodyText: Fixed now.

@@ -0,0 +1,6 @@
+// This example demonstrates how to use the JDBC client with complex data types such as arrays,
+// binary, blobs, clob, and date/time fields.
+// Note that the relevant database driver JAR
+//should be placed in the `BALLERINA_HOME/bre/lib` folder. However, this sample is based on an
+//H2 database and the H2 database driver JAR is included by default in the Ballerina distribution.
+//Therefore, it is not required to copy the driver JAR for the H2 database.

nodes.bodyText:
The column count for BBEs is usually 80, or there'll be breaks in between when rendering. Shall we fix everywhere?
https://github.com/ballerina-platform/ballerina-lang/blob/master/docs/bbe-guidelines/bbe-guidelines.md
Included to add BBEs
The above need to be fixed in other places (looks like 6) as well.

Shall we wrap this at 80 columns? Otherwise this will cause problems when rendering the example. Refer to https://github.com/ballerina-platform/ballerina-lang/blob/master/docs/bbe-guidelines/bbe-guidelines.md for the practices followed when writing BBEs
Is there a need for this record to be an open one?
Applicable to other places where open records are defined
